member.name: T:BitMono.Core.Analyzing.ArgumentTracer
member.summary: Provides argument tracing capabilities for method calls using Echo's data flow graph. This service traces arguments from call instructions backward through the data flow, handling variables, constants, branches, and control flow complexity.

member.name: M:BitMono.Core.Analyzing.ArgumentTracer.TraceArguments(AsmResolver.DotNet.Code.Cil.CilMethodBody,AsmResolver.PE.DotNet.Cil.CilInstruction)
member.summary: Traces the arguments of a call instruction using Echo's data flow graph.
member.param: The method body containing the call instruction.
The call instruction to trace arguments for.
member.returns: Array of instruction indices that produce the arguments, or null if tracing fails.

member.name: M:BitMono.Core.Analyzing.ArgumentTracer.TraceArgumentsRobust(AsmResolver.DotNet.Code.Cil.CilMethodBody,AsmResolver.PE.DotNet.Cil.CilInstruction,System.Int32)
member.summary: Traces arguments using stack simulation algorithm.

member.name: M:BitMono.Core.Analyzing.ArgumentTracer.GetStackDepthAtInstruction(AsmResolver.DotNet.Code.Cil.CilMethodBody,System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculates the stack depth at a specific instruction.

member.name: M:BitMono.Core.Analyzing.ArgumentTracer.GetStackPushCount(AsmResolver.PE.DotNet.Cil.CilInstruction)
member.summary: Gets the number of values pushed onto the stack by an instruction.

member.name: M:BitMono.Core.Analyzing.ArgumentTracer.GetStackPopCount(AsmResolver.PE.DotNet.Cil.CilInstruction)
member.summary: Gets the number of values popped from the stack by an instruction.

member.name: M:BitMono.Core.Analyzing.ArgumentTracer.GetVarPushCount(AsmResolver.PE.DotNet.Cil.CilInstruction)
member.summary: Gets the variable push count for variable-push instructions.

member.name: M:BitMono.Core.Analyzing.ArgumentTracer.GetVarPopCount(AsmResolver.PE.DotNet.Cil.CilInstruction)
member.summary: Gets the variable pop count for variable-pop instructions.

member.name: M:BitMono.Core.Analyzing.ArgumentTracer.TraceArgumentsFromBegin(AsmResolver.DotNet.Code.Cil.CilMethodBody,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Traces arguments from the begin instruction to the call instruction.

member.name: M:BitMono.Core.Analyzing.ArgumentTracer.IsSystemVoid(AsmResolver.DotNet.ITypeDescriptor)
member.summary: Checks if a type is System.Void.

member.name: M:BitMono.Core.Analyzing.ArgumentTracer.TraceStringArgument(AsmResolver.DotNet.Code.Cil.CilMethodBody,AsmResolver.PE.DotNet.Cil.CilInstruction,System.Int32)
member.summary: Traces a string argument from a call instruction.
member.param: The method body containing the call instruction.
The call instruction to trace.
The index of the string argument to trace (0-based).
member.returns: The string value if found, null otherwise.

member.name: M:BitMono.Core.Analyzing.ArgumentTracer.TraceTypeArgument(AsmResolver.DotNet.Code.Cil.CilMethodBody,AsmResolver.PE.DotNet.Cil.CilInstruction,System.Int32)
member.summary: Traces a type argument from a call instruction.
member.param: The method body containing the call instruction.
The call instruction to trace.
The index of the type argument to trace (0-based).
member.returns: The type definition if found, null otherwise.

member.name: M:BitMono.Core.Analyzing.ArgumentTracer.ExtractStringFromMethodCall(AsmResolver.DotNet.Code.Cil.CilMethodBody,AsmResolver.PE.DotNet.Cil.CilInstruction)
member.summary: Extracts string from a method call instruction.

member.name: M:BitMono.Core.Analyzing.CriticalBaseTypesCriticalAnalyzer.YieldAncestors(AsmResolver.DotNet.TypeDefinition)
member.summary: Yields the full class names of all ancestors across the inheritence chain of , including itself.

member.name: M:BitMono.Core.Analyzing.ReflectionCriticalAnalyzer.HandleMemberOverrideReferences(AsmResolver.DotNet.IMemberDefinition)
member.summary: Handles member override references to prevent base members from being obfuscated.
member.param: The member that was found through reflection.

member.name: M:BitMono.Core.Analyzing.ReflectionCriticalAnalyzer.GetBaseMembers(AsmResolver.DotNet.IMemberDefinition)
member.summary: Gets the base members that the given member overrides.
member.param: The member to find base overrides for.
member.returns: Collection of base members that are overridden.

member.name: M:BitMono.Core.Analyzing.ReflectionCriticalAnalyzer.IsMethodOverride(AsmResolver.DotNet.MethodDefinition,AsmResolver.DotNet.MethodDefinition)
member.summary: Determines if a method overrides a base method.
member.param: The derived method.
The potential base method.
member.returns: True if the derived method overrides the base method.

member.name: T:BitMono.Core.Attributes.ConfigureForNativeCodeAttribute
member.summary: This is necessary to make native code work inside the assembly. See more here: https://docs.washi.dev/asmresolver/guides/dotnet/unmanaged-method-bodies.html However, sometimes it causes issues with the assembly like , that's why you need to manually mark your with .

member.name: T:BitMono.Core.Attributes.DoNotResolveAttribute
member.summary: Represents a sort logic which doesn't include specified in .

member.name: T:BitMono.Core.Attributes.MemberInclusionFlags
member.summary: Flags that specify which types of members should be excluded from resolution (obfuscation). Used with the to control which members are protected from obfuscation.

member.name: F:BitMono.Core.Attributes.MemberInclusionFlags.SpecialRuntime
member.summary: Exclude special runtime members from obfuscation (e.g., special methods, properties, or fields used by the runtime).

member.name: F:BitMono.Core.Attributes.MemberInclusionFlags.Model
member.summary: Exclude model members from obfuscation (e.g., data models, DTOs, or entities that should preserve their structure).

member.name: F:BitMono.Core.Attributes.MemberInclusionFlags.Reflection
member.summary: Exclude members that are used in reflection from obfuscation (e.g., methods, fields, properties accessed via reflection).

member.name: T:BitMono.Core.Attributes.RuntimeMonikerAttribute
member.summary: Represents a mechanism that specifies the runtime moniker of the protection. i.e. if you see this attribute on protection, then only specified attributes are the supported runtime monikers for the protection. If you don't see any of the attributes, then it works everywhere, also, users will get a message via

member.name: P:BitMono.Core.Attributes.RuntimeMonikerAttribute.Name
member.summary: Gets the name of the runtime moniker.

member.name: T:BitMono.Core.Attributes.RuntimeMonikerMonoAttribute
member.summary: Represents a mechanism that specifies the runtime moniker of the protection as a Mono. i.e if you see this attribute on protection then only specified attributes are the supported runtime monikers for the protection. If you don't see any of the attributes then it works everywhere, also, users will get a message via

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.AllowNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that null is allowed as an input even if the corresponding type disallows it.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.ConstantExpectedAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the specified method parameter expects a constant.
member.remarks: This can be used to inform tooling that a constant should be used as an argument for the annotated parameter.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.ConstantExpectedAttribute.Min
member.summary: Indicates the minimum bound of the expected constant, inclusive.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.ConstantExpectedAttribute.Max
member.summary: Indicates the maximum bound of the expected constant, inclusive.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DisallowNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that null is disallowed as an input even if the corresponding type allows it.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DoesNotReturnAttribute
member.summary: Applied to a method that will never return under any circumstance.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DoesNotReturnIfAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that the method will not return if the associated Boolean parameter is passed the specified value.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DoesNotReturnIfAttribute.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes the attribute with the specified parameter value.
member.param: The condition parameter value. Code after the method will be considered unreachable by diagnostics if the argument to the associated parameter matches this value.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DoesNotReturnIfAttribute.ParameterValue
member.summary: Gets the condition parameter value.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.ExperimentalAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that an API is experimental and it may change in the future.
member.remarks: This attribute allows call sites to be flagged with a diagnostic that indicates that an experimental feature is used. Authors can use this attribute to ship preview features in their assemblies.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.ExperimentalAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, specifying the ID that the compiler will use when reporting a use of the API the attribute applies to.
member.param: The ID that the compiler will use when reporting a use of the API the attribute applies to.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.ExperimentalAttribute.DiagnosticId
member.summary: Gets the ID that the compiler will use when reporting a use of the API the attribute applies to.
member.remarks:
The diagnostic ID is shown in build output for warnings and errors.
This property represents the unique ID that can be used to suppress the warnings or errors, if needed.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.ExperimentalAttribute.UrlFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the URL for corresponding documentation. The API accepts a format string instead of an actual URL, creating a generic URL that includes the diagnostic ID.
member.value: The format string that represents a URL to corresponding documentation.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MaybeNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that an output may be null even if the corresponding type disallows it.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MaybeNullWhenAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that when a method returns , the parameter may be null even if the corresponding type disallows it.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MaybeNullWhenAttribute.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes the attribute with the specified return value condition.
member.param: The return value condition. If the method returns this value, the associated parameter may be null.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MaybeNullWhenAttribute.ReturnValue
member.summary: Gets the return value condition.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MemberNotNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that the method or property will ensure that the listed field and property members have not-null values.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MemberNotNullAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes the attribute with a field or property member.
member.param: The field or property member that is promised to be not-null.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MemberNotNullAttribute.#ctor(System.String[])
member.summary: Initializes the attribute with the list of field and property members.
member.param: The list of field and property members that are promised to be not-null.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MemberNotNullAttribute.Members
member.summary: Gets field or property member names.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MemberNotNullWhenAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that the method or property will ensure that the listed field and property members have not-null values when returning with the specified return value condition.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MemberNotNullWhenAttribute.#ctor(System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes the attribute with the specified return value condition and a field or property member.
member.param: The return value condition. If the method returns this value, the associated parameter will not be null.
The field or property member that is promised to be not-null.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MemberNotNullWhenAttribute.#ctor(System.Boolean,System.String[])
member.summary: Initializes the attribute with the specified return value condition and list of field and property members.
member.param: The return value condition. If the method returns this value, the associated parameter will not be null.
The list of field and property members that are promised to be not-null.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MemberNotNullWhenAttribute.ReturnValue
member.summary: Gets the return value condition.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MemberNotNullWhenAttribute.Members
member.summary: Gets field or property member names.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that an output will not be null even if the corresponding type allows it. Specifies that an input argument was not null when the call returns.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullIfNotNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that the output will be non-null if the named parameter is non-null.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullIfNotNullAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes the attribute with the associated parameter name.
member.param: The associated parameter name. The output will be non-null if the argument to the parameter specified is non-null.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullIfNotNullAttribute.ParameterName
member.summary: Gets the associated parameter name.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullWhenAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that when a method returns , the parameter will not be null even if the corresponding type allows it.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullWhenAttribute.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes the attribute with the specified return value condition.
member.param: The return value condition. If the method returns this value, the associated parameter will not be null.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullWhenAttribute.ReturnValue
member.summary: Gets the return value condition.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.SetsRequiredMembersAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that this constructor sets all required members for the current type, and callers do not need to set any required members themselves.

member.name: T:System.Index
member.summary: Represent a type can be used to index a collection either from the start or the end.

member.name: M:System.Index.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Construct an Index using a value and indicating if the index is from the start or from the end.
member.param: The index value. it has to be zero or positive number.
Indicating if the index is from the start or from the end.
member.remarks: If the Index constructed from the end, index value 1 means pointing at the last element and index value 0 means pointing at beyond last element.

member.name: P:System.Index.Start
member.summary: Create an Index pointing at first element.

member.name: P:System.Index.End
member.summary: Create an Index pointing at beyond last element.

member.name: M:System.Index.FromStart(System.Int32)
member.summary: Create an Index from the start at the position indicated by the value.
member.param: The index value from the start.

member.name: M:System.Index.FromEnd(System.Int32)
member.summary: Create an Index from the end at the position indicated by the value.
member.param: The index value from the end.

member.name: P:System.Index.Value
member.summary: Returns the index value.

member.name: P:System.Index.IsFromEnd
member.summary: Indicates whether the index is from the start or the end.

member.name: M:System.Index.GetOffset(System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculate the offset from the start using the giving collection length.
member.param: The length of the collection that the Index will be used with. length has to be a positive value
member.remarks: For performance reason, we don't validate the input length parameter and the returned offset value against negative values. we don't validate either the returned offset is greater than the input length. It is expected Index will be used with collections which always have non negative length/count. If the returned offset is negative and then used to index a collection will get out of range exception which will be same affect as the validation.

member.name: M:System.Index.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Indicates whether the current Index object is equal to another object of the same type.
member.param: An object to compare with this object

member.name: M:System.Index.Equals(System.Index)
member.summary: Indicates whether the current Index object is equal to another Index object.
member.param: An object to compare with this object

member.name: M:System.Index.GetHashCode
member.summary: Returns the hash code for this instance.

member.name: M:System.Index.op_Implicit(System.Int32)~System.Index
member.summary: Converts integer number to an Index.

member.name: M:System.Index.ToString
member.summary: Converts the value of the current Index object to its equivalent string representation.

member.name: T:System.Range
member.summary: Represent a range has start and end indexes.

member.name: P:System.Range.Start
member.summary: Represent the inclusive start index of the Range.

member.name: P:System.Range.End
member.summary: Represent the exclusive end index of the Range.

member.name: M:System.Range.#ctor(System.Index,System.Index)
member.summary: Construct a Range object using the start and end indexes.
member.param: Represent the inclusive start index of the range.
Represent the exclusive end index of the range.

member.name: M:System.Range.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Indicates whether the current Range object is equal to another object of the same type.
member.param: An object to compare with this object

member.name: M:System.Range.Equals(System.Range)
member.summary: Indicates whether the current Range object is equal to another Range object.
member.param: An object to compare with this object

member.name: M:System.Range.GetHashCode
member.summary: Returns the hash code for this instance.

member.name: M:System.Range.ToString
member.summary: Converts the value of the current Range object to its equivalent string representation.

member.name: M:System.Range.StartAt(System.Index)
member.summary: Create a Range object starting from start index to the end of the collection.

member.name: M:System.Range.EndAt(System.Index)
member.summary: Create a Range object starting from first element in the collection to the end Index.

member.name: P:System.Range.All
member.summary: Create a Range object starting from first element to the end.

member.name: M:System.Range.GetOffsetAndLength(System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculate the start offset and length of range object using a collection length.
member.param: The length of the collection that the range will be used with. length has to be a positive value.
member.remarks: For performance reason, we don't validate the input length parameter against negative values. It is expected Range will be used with collections which always have non negative length/count. We validate the range is inside the length scope though.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CollectionBuilderAttribute.#ctor(System.Type,System.String)
member.summary: Initialize the attribute to refer to the method on the type.
member.param: The type of the builder to use to construct the collection.
The name of the method on the builder to use to construct the collection.
member.remarks: must refer to a static method that accepts a single parameter of type and returns an instance of the collection being built containing a copy of the data from that span. In future releases of .NET, additional patterns may be supported.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CollectionBuilderAttribute.BuilderType
member.summary: Gets the type of the builder to use to construct the collection.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CollectionBuilderAttribute.MethodName
member.summary: Gets the name of the method on the builder to use to construct the collection.
member.remarks: This should match the metadata name of the target method. For example, this might be ".ctor" if targeting the type's constructor.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CompilerFeatureRequiredAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that compiler support for a particular feature is required for the location where this attribute is applied.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CompilerFeatureRequiredAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the type.
member.param: The name of the feature to indicate.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CompilerFeatureRequiredAttribute.FeatureName
member.summary: The name of the compiler feature.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CompilerFeatureRequiredAttribute.IsOptional
member.summary: If true, the compiler can choose to allow access to the location where this attribute is applied if it does not understand .

member.name: F:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CompilerFeatureRequiredAttribute.RefStructs
member.summary: The used for the ref structs C# feature.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CompilerFeatureRequiredAttribute.RequiredMembers
member.summary: The used for the required members C# feature.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsExternalInit
member.summary: Reserved to be used by the compiler for tracking metadata. This class should not be used by developers in source code.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.OverloadResolutionPriorityAttribute
member.summary: Specifies the priority of a member in overload resolution. When unspecified, the default priority is 0.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.OverloadResolutionPriorityAttribute.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The priority of the attributed member. Higher numbers are prioritized, lower numbers are deprioritized. 0 is the default if no attribute is present.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.OverloadResolutionPriorityAttribute.Priority
member.summary: The priority of the member.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.ParamCollectionAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that a method will allow a variable number of arguments in its invocation.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.RequiredMemberAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that a type has required members or that a member is required.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.RequiresLocationAttribute
member.summary: Reserved for use by a compiler for tracking metadata. This attribute should not be used by developers in source code.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.SkipLocalsInitAttribute
member.summary: Used to indicate to the compiler that the .locals init flag should not be set in method headers.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.Versioning.RequiresPreviewFeaturesAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified message.
member.param: An optional message associated with this attribute instance.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.Versioning.RequiresPreviewFeaturesAttribute.Message
member.summary: Returns the optional message associated with this attribute instance.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.Versioning.RequiresPreviewFeaturesAttribute.Url
